Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JoeyBoy888
Reviews.Content: Used this place for my my final night in the Seattle Area. Right across the street from the airport entrance so I dropped my rental car off the night before my early morning flight and use hotel transportation to get around. Great check in staff. Class bar and restaurant in lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with classy bar and restrant with fine dinning.”
Reviews.Author: yelmwa
Reviews.Content: Very nice bar fine dining on site. The room are large with pillow top mattresses. They also love for me to bring my dog along. My dogs like to go and the love the room service. Try it you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: NAUgrad2005
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for a steal on Priceline (about 1/3 of the 'Best Available Rate') and were pleasantly surprised by how nice this hotel is! After a very long day of flying (15 hours), the shuttle picked us up at the airport and drove us across the street to the hotel. We were checked in within a few minutes and directed to our room, which had 2 comfy beds, a nice work area and TV. The bathroom was nice with plenty of counter space and larger towels. The hotel offers a shuttle to a nearby shopping mall area, so we took that to get dinner and wander around. I thought it was nice that the hotel has a business center that anyone can use, as well as an Alaska Airlines kiosk in the lobby. The rooms are well soundproofed...I didn't hear anyone in the hall or any flights leaving the airport. All in all, a great hotel for a restful night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel by the airport”
Reviews.Author: anderl
Reviews.Content: Work conference near the airport, Hilton was an excellent place. Clean rooms, huge hotel, great fitness center and pool area.

Reviews.Title: “We were but passing through”
Reviews.Author: willowMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Our express 8 hr visit, may have been quick but it had everything we needed, and nothing we didn't, we wheeled our bags across from the airport with no location troubles just as dusk settled, the room was clean, beds comfortable and welcoming, and after 24 hours of travelling, any little thing could have jared our mood. The welcoming hot apple cider was an unexpected treat, subtle and warming a wonderful delight enjoyed by all members of the family. We ate at the hotel restaurant, a little more upmarket than our usual, but we were after convenience and real food, and we enjoyed a magnificent feast, though disappointingly for all too tired to fully digest it all.(Follow the head waiters suggestions, he knows what he is talking about and enjoy the spectical of the presentation). We had to depart before breakfast, but chose not to waste time eating instead of sleeping so picked up a few nibbles from the well stocked shop (don't forget to look for the Sleepless in Seattle night wear) rather than order room service. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “quick but pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SCF2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on route to Mexico this March. We checked in late and left early, but our time there was enjoyable. The hotel is huge, and "maze like" - but we didn't mind. Took a peek at the gym/pool and both looked nice. Recommended for a stay when needing the airport as its right across the street. Note: parking is $24/night, too bad! We got this hotel on priceline for a great deal and parking off-site, so it wasn't too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Washington State National Guard Militia Ball 2012”
Reviews.Author: KsW_MD
Reviews.Content: Came down here with Canadian Scottish Pipes and Drums to entertain our American hosts at their annual Militia Ball. Hotel is walking distance to SeaTac airport (if you don't have much luggage!). Classy Hotel with major league ambience. Comfortable, well-appointed rooms. Modern TV. SBux onsite and open mornings only. Conference Center fully equipped and nicely laid out. Restaurant a tad expensive. Denny's up the street for those less inclined to dine here. WANG hospitality terrific. Hors d'oeuvres excellent. Altogether, a very enjoyable weekend. Military room rate about $105. It's bargain at that price. Now, how to figure out how to get that rate travelling independently!!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Mutumia
Reviews.Content: We booked on Travelocity at a most excellent rate (other than parking cost!) and enjoyed the two bed room we were given as I had a cough and didn't bother my husband. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet. Had breakfast at the restaurant - the buffet is better priced than the full breakfast on the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: BiztravelguyBoston
Reviews.Content: I had a long flight from the east coast into Seattle, and arrived at 5:30 pm. By 5:45, I was in my room - so the location is a huge plus. You can walk from the terminal (following signs for the light rail) in about ten minutes; alternatively, they have a shuttle. I was greeted quickly and pleasantly. I had booked via a third-party site, and when I asked about a king bed instead of 2 doubles, they offered me a $10 upgrade for the king. I took it in a heartbeat. My room was on the 4th floor - very comfortable, great shampoo/soap, etc. Bed was superb. Staff was outstanding throughout - when I asked about the easiest way to get to my rental car facility, they offered to drive me, saving me a ton of time. Huge points for that! Free wifi in the lobby - for the life of me I don't understand why Hilton doesn't offer it in the rooms, but tat seems to be a corporate policy, albeit not a wise one. 7-11 is a 5 minute walk, and has a Red Box on site for those of us who rent movies to watch during long flights, there is a Denny's 5 minutes away for a breakfast option. The on-site restaurant offers their lunch menu at the bar all day long, so you don't have to break the bank for a good meal. Hotel itself would be a 4 star rating due to comfort and convenience, the terrific staff bumps it up to a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel at the airport”
Reviews.Author: fairbankssheila
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Excellent hotel and the nicest of all airport hotels by far. Service is average- not bad not great Wonderful outdoor pool

Reviews.Title: “Directions to the bridge to the hotel from the airport-- with a bit of a hike”
Reviews.Author: PhillyVoyager
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from the reviews that talked about the connection to the airport and it worked without me having to stand around waiting for a shuttle, but wouldn't have been practical if I had more luggage. There's no directions, so here is what you do: Follow the signs for "Light Rail" because they are well marked. It will require going through a series of parking garages, but it's well lit and the path is well marked. At the end of the garages, you'll see a connector bridge and the station ahead. Take the elevator to the ground level and you'll be facing the back of the Hilton. Cross the street and walk about a block and you'll see the entrance to the hotel to your left. The hotel itself was fine, about as expected for an airport Hilton. The walls were a bit thin because I could easily hear my neighbor coughing, but I didn't find outside airport noise to be a problem. The staff at the front desk and my shuttle back to the airport the next morning were friendly--opted not to walk back. I was quickly in and out so didn't sample restaurants or other services.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: rjeffries
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in nearly every major chain hotel in the Renton/Tacoma area of Seattle. I have skipped around mostly trying to find a quiet hotel that is clean, has consistent service and a fitness center larger than a shoebox. I stayed at the Airport Hilton a couple of weeks ago for three nights on a business trip. The entry and lobby area look newer and are nice. I was unfortunately sent to the back of the hotel (and I mean the very back) which was a haul every time I went to my room. The back part of the hotel looks older and while it was quiet, I would ask not to be put back there again. Self-park is also a very inconvenient walk so just plan to pay for valet or give yourself 5 minutes to walk to your car. The rooms themselves are clean and comfortable (I always like Hilton's beds) and as I mentioned already, almost blissfully quiet at least in my area of timbuktu. I ordered room service my last day for breakfast and it was very good; overpriced but I expect that. Service overall was good. It wasn't "over-the-top" fussy but they were there if you asked. The fitness room is AWESOME. It is truly a large space with multiple cardio machines and weight machines. I was happy to have space to do free weights without having someone 2 inches from me and available floor to roll out a mat and do core work, etc. I will be headed back again this coming week so I'll update if there is anything new or interesting.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: lacamas
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Called to request a room in a quiet part of the hotel but was told that because it was booked through Priceline, we pretty much don't have a right to make any requests. Sure enough our room was on the second floor by the ice machine. Spotty wifi. Restaurant was overpriced. Nice enough property but wouldn't pay published rates for a room here. (Stayed at the Osaka Hilton the next night...they do it differently there, don't they? Excellent 2 nights there!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; extremely large.”
Reviews.Author: Eric Y
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything one would expect in a Hilton; clean well-appointed room, good in-hotel restaurant, and extremely helpful staff. The one knock on it is the fact that the walk from the parking garage to the front desk is really long (longest I've ever experienced). Not a big deal, obviously, but I'd advise dropping your bags off and checking in, then going to park the car. Other than that, a top-notch property.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel stopover”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located directly across the street from the SeaTac Airport. Lobby is huge and spacious, check-in was friendly and quick. Room was very nice, two double beds, flat screen TV, in room safe which is a big plus, nice bathroom, very clean, with huge fluffy towels. Also offers complimetary shampoo, body lotion, and conditioner. The one big minus is no free wifi, at $12.95 for 24 hours or $4.99 for one hour is in my opinion a rip off. But find that most American chains charge so guess they are in line with others. There is a restaurant, did not eat there, but prices seemed quite high. Free shuttle from/to the airport is included in the rate and runs every 20 minutes. There are a couple of restaurants in the area, 13 Coins about one block away, and some fast food restaurants about 3/4 blocks south. If you arrive by the Sond Transit Link train from downtown Seattle you are but steps away from the hotel. You can walk from the hotel to the airport in less than 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Solo67_4
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of the Hilton Hotel chain. Through out my travels, they have not disappointed me. This particular hotel has a large layout. There is an open large court yard in the middle of the hotel with the rooms wrapping around it. One very large square. I am sure the court yard is very pretty during spring and summer. I am from the Seattle so I can say that previous reviews regarding noise from the surrounding area should not be given much attention. The hotel is right next to Seatac Airport! You are going to have the usual hustle and bustle that comes with staying near the airport. There are plenty of rooms that do not face the main road. I only heard one plane the entire night. It is to be expected. The room was very nice, usual Hilton standards. The bed was very comfortable as well as the pillows. The pillows impressed me so much that I looked at the tag inside to find the manufacturer and I will be purchasing a few. Nice layout of room, large flat screen TV, desk, safe and chair with ottoman for reading. The cons: no free wifi unless you are an HHonors member. The bathroom was one of the smallest I've seen at a Hilton, though very nice with basic toiletries provided. The ice and vending machines are difficult to locate, no map provided by the hotel. Plan on paying for parking! Self parking is $20 per night in the hotel garage. I did not ask about valet, however I noticed cars parked via the valet service were NOT parked in the large garage but out in the elements. Odd... I like the zip in/zip out option for check out. However, in regard to this particular hotel, you must use your hotel room key to enter and exit the garage. There is a drop box for your room key after you swipe it to leave but it was NOT noted on the bill slipped under the door. You have NO way of knowing about this beforehand. If you follow the directions on the bill, leaving your key in the room, you can not exit the parking area. The devil is in the details. A little more customer service at check in would help OR this hotel can not this on the bill. Overall, happy with my one night. I would stay again but I would ask more questions at check in. ****Hotel restaurant is expensive**** Try the 13 Coins restaurant, it is less than a block away and is a local hot spot.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great all around experience....”
Reviews.Author: Tony F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with our mini-dachshund in October 2011 during the Zombcon convention. The hotel staff went out of their way the entire weekend to make us feel comfortable and welcome. They also made our dog welcome by placing a picture of her on their facebook page as the featured pet of the week. The food in the restaurant while a little more expensive than what you would get outside, was wonderful and filling. If I had one complaint, it was the bartender at the end of a LONG day who served me a DiSaronno on the rocks in a glass that was severely tainted by detergent. Not the best way to end a day, but with him having been there since 7am and it was now 11pm, I can forgive it. All in all, we would love the opportunity to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: IslandDrifter23
Reviews.Content: We had a 10 hour layover in Seattle, so I thought I should priceline a hotel so we could get some sleep. We ended getting the Hilton. I wasn't looking forward to going to another Hilton after my Hilton Long Beach experience. But it was a great hotel. It started off with there free shuttle that runs 3 times an hour. With very friendly staff from the shuttle driver to the front desk. The room was very clean and updated, with a very comfy bed and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: storewanderer
Reviews.Content: This might be the nicest (it also looks to be the newest) property near the airport. But it is just okay. I arrived with a Priceline reservation and when I presented by HHonors Gold Card, they rudely told me since I "booked on Priceline" that I would not receive "anything" for the card. I was quickly handed my key cards and told about the daily parking fee of about $20 (which they charged sales tax on?). I went to the room and it was a tiny room in the corner surrounded by a doorway, hallway, and the road that runs alongside the hotel. My room was on the ground floor. When I asked for the second floor my request was denied due to my use of Priceline. I understand. The good thing about my room is I could walk right out the door and get to the light rail station. It was about a 25 minute walk between my room and the parking garage by using hallways, but the time was cut some by going out that side door and around back outside. There was also a small parking lot out back that was just a few minutes walk from my room, which the staff neglected to tell me about. Now, the room. The room was just a tiny room. It was like a Motel 6 sized room, though very clean and nicely appointed. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was small but again it was well appointed; good shower and good towels. Overall, the property is nice enough but it is the little things like the small room, the long walk to parking, the general attitude of the staff...

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tunsi3
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel close to SeaTac. The staff was helpful and the room was clean. Nice sheets and towels but bathroom was a little dated and small. We did not eat at the restaurant, but it looks like a good place for breakfast or a quick cup of coffee. The room was quiet. I would recommend this hotel if you need to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The farthest Room I ever stay!”
Reviews.Author: Melody_vancouver2010
Reviews.Content: If you ever want to stay at this hotel, don't stay at the Garden Level or Pool Level rooms. The room that we stayed in was outdated with small bathroom. We walk very far and it seems we enter a labyrinth. At check out, the front desk didn't give us option to pay cash.....and everything automatically charged to my credit card even though I booked the rooms throughh the hotel website NOT expedia etc. Parking was expensive for airport area. I will not stay with this hotel again. If you want to book at this hotel......make sure you choose the new tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Froglady9
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice this month, before and after a trip to Hawaii. The room was excellent, comfortable and very clean. Good bed. Hotel staff is friendly and very helpful. Will definitely come back. Restaurant is a bit disappointing, gift shop pricey but well stocked. Easy access to the lightrail.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay....restaurant less so”
Reviews.Author: david4455
Reviews.Content: Our SeaTac hotel of choice. Always treated cordially and acknowledged as a repeat client. The room was large and comfortable. A bit stuffy and difficult to find a good sleeping temperature. The only disappointment was the restaurant. Spencer's steak house use to be a destination restaurant serving first rate steaks and sides. The service friendly and efficient. I believe it is now part of the Hilton hotel chain and the service and the food have suffered. Attention to detail was lacking and the food was really no better then an average hotel restaurant. We use to stay at this location because a meal at Spencer's was a treat...the restaurant is no longer " the" draw.

Reviews.Title: “Great SEA-TAC option”
Reviews.Author: EricH61
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on our way back from Alaska in order to avoid a redeye flight. Having been in Seattle previously, we elected simply to stay a hotel at the airport. The Hilton was top quality all the way. The convenience of simply walking out of the airport, over the sky bridge, and into the hotel was simply marvelous. Check-in was swift and professional. We only had our carry-on luggage due to a misunderstanding with Continental (they had retained our checked bags in the belief that we weren't leaving the airport between our flights) and we were cheerfully provided with everything we needed. Our Garden View-King room was comfortable and clean; we appreciated the tranquil interior garden which belied the busy airport just outside. The bathrooms were particularly nice, with top quality amenities. There is a Spencer's right in the hotel, which is a real plus. We weren't up for a lot of food, though, and ordered in the bar instead. Food was great, but our cocktail waitress was even better. Witty and efficient, she turned what was just going to be a throwaway meal into a memorable experience. Our waitress at breakfast was equally good -- we were running a little short on time and she expedited our order with ease. We had an excellent room rate due to prepaying. I'm sometimes reluctant to prepay on a location I've never seen, but the Hilton Seattle Airport exceeded our expectations and was a unexpectedly pleasant end to a very long vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Long and Winding Road”
Reviews.Author: daijobu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton in early December 2011. Booked a "Garden View" room and not realizing that it took over 5 minutes to walk from Lobby to the room itself. The hotel is only about 4 storeys high, and the numbering of the rooms basically reads "1" + "floor" + "room number (on that floor)". If you have a lot of luggage with you, I highly suggest that you emphasize on getting a room closer to the entrance. I had 5 pieces of luggage as I checked in, and the receptionist handling the check-in assigned one of the furthest rooms possible which took me over 7 minutes to push the luggage trolley all the way to my room. After getting all my luggage into the room, which I'd expected to be a larger size considering I was supposed to be paying for a "deluxe garden view" (the room is smaller than what you would find in a Hampton Inn), I headed out to get food as their restaurant was closed. Along the way I asked the receptionist why I was given a room so far away when I had all that luggage. The girl just frowned and said the hotel was fully booked and that I should have made the request earlier. When I told her that I had requested - as I booked on-line - that the room not be far from the elevator, she then said "can I send someone to help you then?" Being a Hilton Gold VIP member, I am entitled to either a free upgrade (where available), or breakfast, or a 1000 points HHonors bonus. I had an early flight out so I skipped breakfast. Upon check-out I asked if she would note on the bill that I should get the 1000 points, and the girl (a different undertrained person) looks at me and smiles as she recites, "oh, just tell the Hilton Hhonors people that you didn't have breakfast and they should give you the miles." What Hilton Hhonors people? It was unfortunate that I didn't have time to speak to her more, but perhaps that's a blessing as I don't think it would have helped me, but possibly only help her learn that I don't work for Hilton, nor are there Hilton Hhonors people standing around me to hear a plea about me not having breakfast at one of their lesser properties so they award me with 1000 miles. Being a Gold VIP member, and having to deal with this kind of lack of service, I don't recommend staying at this hotel unless you're travelling with over 400 other people and all of you want to stay in the same property. While the hotel is very near the airport, and that right out the back-door of the property is the lightrail stop, downtown Seattle is not 15 minutes a ride away as their website claims. The best thing I have to say about this hotel would be the shuttle bus drivers as they were the most helpful of the lot.

Reviews.Title: “Walking Distance to Airport”
Reviews.Author: waterlogged23
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to the airport. Extremely clean with very comfortable bed and bedding. Staff friendly and helpful. Restaurants close by. We tried 13 Coins, a 24 hour restaurant with an extensive menu and had a very good meal. You can walk to the airport easily.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport and comfy”
Reviews.Author: MsRumphius
Reviews.Content: Room was great. Nice linens and bath products. Shuttle runs 24/7 and on time. We ate fresh salmon with arugala pesto in their restaurant which was cooked to perfection. Lobby area has a nice fireplace to sit by. Light rail is across street which will take you into town.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: k s
Reviews.Content: My experiance with this property will send me to Marriott. I am a Dimond member and live a majority of my life in Hilton hotels. I've stayed here on several occasions and they continue to disapoint. They placed me in an accessible room the size of a small football field and stated my reservation requested this type of room. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeanpW
Reviews.Content: This is a welcome destination for travelers overnighting at Seatac. We often stay here the night before an early morning flight or after an evening flight arrival, rather than make the 100-mile drive. Rooms are very comfortable and quiet. Check-in and check-out are quick and there's a thrice-hourly shuttle. However, you can also walk to the hotel through the Seatac light rail station in 15 minutes or less, depending on airline. What really distinguishes this hotel from other airport hotels is the high- quality, friendly service and the excellent food and beverage offerings. The restaurant is a very good steakhouse and the bar is convivial and well-stocked. You can also take the light rail from the adjacent station to downtown Seattle in about 25-30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable well located property”
Reviews.Author: culruaIreland
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal property for business travellers, close to the city approximately 35 minutes on the light railway and minutes (walk) from the airport. Good Breakfast, prompt check in and out, professional and efficient concierge. Room was large and comfortable. Good wifi access in the lobby. Bar food a little expensive but quality of the food was good. Staff in general were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Long walk, but great choice for the airport”
Reviews.Author: tiffabits
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton for an overnight trip to Seattle recently, and were pleasantly surprised. The facility is older, but everything has been kept up quite well. The pool area is very pleasant indeed, and the room we were given was quite enormous. Because of the design of the building (it is only two floors) there can be some substantial walking to get to where you need to go within the hotel. There is no street parking available, and the hotel's parking is fairly expensive ($25 or so per night if I recall).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised with this property!”
Reviews.Author: jeonyc
Reviews.Content: This property is well maintained, well staffed and has a very nice restaurant! If I ever needed to stay by the airport again, this is the first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and good.”
Reviews.Author: denise V
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night stay prior to flying out of Seatac the following morning. The rooms are a good size with really comfortable beds, nice bed linens and towels. The starbucks coffee shop in the lobby is great for a quick breakfast. The location to the airport is excellent and the shuttle bus drivers are prompt and friendly. The restaurant is quite upscale and on the expensive side. If you are looking for a good value meal in a relaxed environment, try Roasters smokehouse just across the road. Right next to the hotel is Wally valet car parking for the airport. The hotel charges $4.95 an hour for internet acess and $20 a night for parking, both are a complete rip off. The cheap hotels are offering free acess and the more upmarket hotels are charging, in this day and age there is no need for those fees. We booked our car in with Wally park which were charging $13 for a 24 hour period.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but decent”
Reviews.Author: Kubzfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly across from SEA TAC airport. Location location location..... Hotel is very large. Conference Center out back can be a hike from the front lobby. Rooms are nice. Lobby bar is nice and service is very friendly. Parking can be pricey but it is an airport hotel. Did not eat here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lacleveland
Reviews.Content: Wonderful helpful staff! I came in late and was leaving early and you took care of everything for me....I greatly appreciate you going the extra mile. Loved those hash browns early the next morning! Thanks for a great but short nights sleep! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Seatac Hilton - Safe, Clean and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Marcia K
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and connect through Seattle airport. I have found that I am most comfortable when staying at the HIlton SEATAC. The service is exceptional. Rooms are always nice and beds are wonderful with great sheets! As a woman who travels alone on a regualar basis I feel the most safe when I stay here.

Reviews.Title: “very nice modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Anjiggy
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice. it is a short walk away from a covered pedestrian bridge/overpass that takes you right to the airport! the room decor is pretty new - new furniture, curtains, lamps, bedding, tv, etc. i loved the bright CFL lights in the bathroom - good for putting on makeup. the only negative is that they charge for parking! so we just took our rental car back to the airport early, and then walked back to the room via that pedestrian overpass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton Stay!”
Reviews.Author: orr333
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay getting in late and leaving early for a morning flight. This property is quite large and could result in a pretty substantial walk to your room. We were in building 1 which is allegedly closest with building 2 being nearer to the large conference center. The fitness center was VERY large filled with the standard PRECOR equipment. I believe I counted 6 treadmills, several ellipticals, bikes, machines and free weights. I dropped my visa card on the shuttle from the airport after dropping off my rental car and it was promptly turned in by the driver which was a huge relief to find honesty! The room was everything I expect in a Hilton from the dreamy, clean bed to the bathroom amenities. You just cannot go wrong with Hiltons including this property. The shuttle runs every 20 minutes and was punctual. The trip to the airport is fast.My sister stayed and used my free breakfast coupons and said it was fantastic...no shock there from me.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, large rooms and convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: NERoth
Reviews.Content: Excellent airport hotel. The room i had was updated, large, and extremely comfortable. Both the room and bathroom were quite clean and I heard no noise from the hallway or adjacent rooms. Service was extremely friendly. Across the street from Sea-Tac and a 5-10 minute van ride away (every 20 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Lparsons7641
Reviews.Content: Got a good price for this place on Hotwire, a great night's rest before a flight and after a long day on train and bus. Right across from the light rail stop (though this wasn't readily apparent at first). Comfortable clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Layover Hotel at SEA”
Reviews.Author: globalflyereal
Reviews.Content: I had a 12 hour layover at SEA and decided to try the HH Seattle Airport & Conference Centre. It is one of if not the closest hotel to the airport. The shuutle buss runs every 20 minutes and picks up at Curb 1 and Curb 3 outside of the arrivals area. The hotel appears to be an older propoerty yet inside it is immaculate. A very classy lobby area with a Spencer's Seafood & Chops restaurant off the lobby. I was very tired and decided on room service. The food was very good and very prompt service. The hotel also states that the room service attendant receives all of the 19% gratuity which I think it great! I did not have time to enjoy much of the hotel as I just wanted to sleep. The bed was a King bed that was extremely comfortable! A nice big screen TV and upgraded washroom amenities were also available. Rates are very reasonable at this location and I would highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Complementary Apple Cider in the Lobby”
Reviews.Author: HikeTheUSA
Reviews.Content: Like the Apple Cider & that we got a great deal on Priceline. The room was modern and the bed was comfortable. Disliked that the parking was twenty dollars a night. Cheaper at Wally Park next door. The internet in the room was $5 an hour, and would disconnect you after each hour to have you renew (very bad if you need to remote in to work).

Reviews.Title: “Very big hotel, you'll walk alot. A little pricey”
Reviews.Author: sirgreg
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 45 other folks for our company sales meeting.. Pros : The best equiped hotel gym I've seen in months. Comfortable rooms. Polite service Nice meeting rooms in the conference center. Good for a conference or sales meeting. Cons : This place is huge. Its a long walk from the front of the hotel to the conference center in the back of the hotel and easy to get lost as they are not big on signage. Restaurant is overly expensive. I must say the food quality was excellent with fresh steaks and Alaskan seafood,but doesnt justify New York prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton Very Close to SEA-TAC”
Reviews.Author: pikapptcu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in October (beginning and end of trip). I have travelled to Seattle many times on business and either stay at the DOubletree close to SEA-TAC or in downtown Seattle. This was my first time at the Hilton. The hotel is close enough to walk to from the terminal but they do offer a shuttle service three times an hour. Each time I needed the shuttle it was there to pick me up within 5 minutes. Reception check-in was very quick and the service was great. This is not a high rise hotel (only 4 floors) so it is very spread out and can take a while to walk from one end to the other, especially if you self park. Rooms were very standard for Hilton and clean. I'll look to stay here on my next trip to Seattle, especially for late arriving flight or an early departure.

Reviews.Title: “Wow the rooms are noisy- bad pipes!!”
Reviews.Author: Duddoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks real sophisticated on the outside and lobby. The staff are good. The room was a good size but everytime the person above you flushes or uses the bath/shower it sounds like a sonic boom in your room. Waking up at 5 am instead of 7 was not fun!! For HHonors members there is no executive lounge and they give you a continental b'fast coupon that can double as $8 off a meal. Probably will not stay here again. I ate in the restaurant (Spencer's I think) the food was good but expensive and the restaurant was empty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: hernameislola
Reviews.Content: I was a little leary of booking through hotwire.com , only because you don't know the Hotel Name beforehand. I booked through hotwire.com and to my surprise was booked at the hilton seattle airport & conference center. i had been looking on their website and wasn't particularly enthused with paying $200.00 a night. I payed 99.86 with all taxes on hotwire.com. The hotel is a very great location if you are flying out of SEATAC. The shuttle comes 3 times an hour which is great. The drivers were very courteous and attentative. Upon arrival check in was very quick , and with great customer service. The lady at the desk was very helpful. The room was great! It had a little patio our into the courtyard which had the pool. The room was very big. VERY clean , I am a housekeeper and I am so picky , but it was great! Overall a great experience. I didn't eat or drink as I brought my own food into the room. Room service was pretty much the same price as any other hotel. LOW noise for an airport/convention hotel. I didn't hear a peep all night. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cb1180
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for a one night layover on my way home from Asia and apparently the hotel was hosting an annual Furry convention, so there were lots of young people dressed in costumes. All in all it was a decent Hilton – comfortable room and decent service. The staff was friendly and accommodated my early arrival request. There was a fair amount of noise throughout the day both coming from the courtyard and from the hall way, but it wasn’t all that obnoxious or unexpected given the convention happening I guess. They certainly have an overzealous housekeeping staff that really wants to do their job. I put the “do not disturb” sign on the door so they didn’t bother me until they caught me leaving (and returning from) my room for lunch and asked if I wanted my room cleaned. I politely told them (both times) that I just checked in and wouldn’t require any service. The hotel is right across the street from the airport and it’s about a 15 min walk, most of which is covered. Just follow the signs to the light rail station, cross over the street to the bus stop/parking lot and turn right.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: IowaGrandparents
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice on the trip. Once for convenience as we began our trip after a late night flight arrival and once at the end of the trip before a morning departure. For a business hotel I'd rate as generally acceptable but nothing special. On the plus side, even at late night, there was a valet on premises to park your car. On the negative side, you had to go find him if you wanted his assistance (both nights). Didn't come to greet us or offer to help with luggage. As a result we decided to simply save the six bucks extra for valet parking. The good news is that the self park is an enclosed garage. The bad news is that it costs $20 a night and seems to be about a quarter mile walk (perhaps a tad exaggerated) from the room elevators. There also seemed to be quite a difference between the rooms we received on the two nights. The first one seemed less fresh and you didn't need an alarm clock because the toilet flush and shower of the room next door served that purpose. The second had turn down service prepared for us when we arrived. The first room had a pillow on the bed with several stains on the cover (but we just tossed that one on the floor -- there were plenty of others on the bed.) The second bed was comfy and spring time fresh. So I guess it's also luck of the draw. The breakfast buffet, however, was pretty nicely done both mornings and it seems as if that is consistent. Not quite as extensive as some Hilton buffets but more than adequate for our purposes and nicely presented. The staff at breakfast seemed a little confused about what is or what isn't included in the complimentary continental coupon for Diamond members but for $3 you can upgrade to the hot buffet, although one day the upgrade included an offer of made to order eggs and the other day it didn't. So for convenience, it's hard to beat -- although International Blvd is lined with alternatives that can be considered. For service it's pretty average and unusually uneven. For price, it seems pretty steep for what you get. In short, although nothing really upset us about the property, next time through, we'll check out another option.

Reviews.Title: “airport hotel-- close and comfortable for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a hotel at Sea-Tac this is a solid choice. Friendly staff, comfortable rooms, and a free shuttle. If you need public transit into the city the train station is across the street. Rooms look like the have had a fairly recent remodel. Only watch out is 1/2 the rooms face the major street/train station so depending on your sleep schedule this might me an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: DuaneSandul
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Silver and almost Gold member, we have enjoyed hotels in their ownership from Coast to Coast and in between, including Hiltons, Embassy Suites, and Homewood Suites. Ironically, our only negative experiences have been in Seattle -- the Embassy Suites Airport we rated 1 and the Hilton at SeaTac gets a 2. Most others we have ranked 4 or 5, so we are prone to like the Hilton chain. That said, the Seattle-Tacoma Airport Hilton seems like a distant cousin. Checking in at the Honors Desk and using points, I was treated indifferently and with a yawn. The hotel layout is a monstrosity -- most rooms are located much to far from the elevator. Their Spencer's Restaurant charges $28 to $49 for most dinner entrees because the hotel is located so far from walkable dining -- cannot remember the last time I ordered pizza delivered to a hotel, but we did. As my wife and I hauled six bags down through the long corridor and lobby at 4:35 am to catch the shuttle to the airport, the alleged bellhop watched us. We had asked check-in for a 4 a.m. wake-up call, but, being cautious, I checked again before we retired for the evening, and it had not been made. After the remarkable stay and service at Hilton's The Palmer House just a few weeks earlier, I couldn't believe this was the same chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great for convenience to airport”
Reviews.Author: polaraubie
Reviews.Content: I have often stayed here when I have an early morning flight from SeaTac. I arrived late in the evening and was still able to get a small meal at the restaurant, and they were willing to serve me outside, though it was a bit too chilly (for others) so that only one other person was at the outside tables making a phone call. The convenience to the light rail there is great when I have gotten in earlier so I can go in to the Market or to a downtown restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Airport Option”
Reviews.Author: djsmapping
Reviews.Content: We live about 3 hours from Seattle, but it's much cheaper for us to fly out of SEA than it is to make a connection through SEA from any of the other airports nearer to us, so we look for hotels at Seattle Airport that are clean, quiet, have good food, and have a "stay and fly" rate, where they keep your car safe while you're away. The Hilton at SEA-TAC does everything we want in a hotel, and more. There are two wings of rooms, a 4-story building right by the check-in desk, where they house people who are Hilton HHonors guests, and another long wing, which is just fine, but a bit of a schlep from the lobby and restaurant. The bell desk is run by people who are obliging and friendly and helpful. Whatever help we need, they provide, cheerfully. You can tell how good the bell desk is by the fact that there are lots of bellmen who have been on the desk for years. The restaurant is basically a steak place -- with really, really good steaks -- but also has a good selection of other dishes, including vegetarian options. We often make a whole meal out of two or three of the appetizers. But even though we're not spending the money that others might spend, the service is never grudging or slow, and we're always treated as if we're buying the big ticket dinners. The restaurant also does a nice breakfast -- buffet style or off the menu. In the lobby, there's a nice bar area with several big-screen TVs, and there's a Starbucks (it is Seattle after all). The rooms are clean, quiet, comfortable. If something isn't right, housekeeping tries very hard to make it right, and quickly. Most recently, we wanted a couple of extra feather pillows -- we called down, the person said "right away", and literally 30 seconds later, there was a knock on the door. Wonderful. 99% of the time, the front desk is seamless and efficient. Sometimes, a new hire or trainee checks us in, and forgets to tell us our options -- for example, as Hilton Gold, I get a couple of breakfast coupons; the most recent stay, when I said I couldn't use them, the clerk said "you can use them for credit on dinner" and I said we would be leaving on the shuttle at 5, well before breakfast, and eating out for dinner with friends. He then FORGOT to say "well, we can credit your account 1000 points instead of giving you coupons which you can't use..." If I had not known I was entitled to the points, I would have lost them. But to the hotel's credit, when I called down and spoke to the front desk manager, she said she'd take care of the credit right away. Their airport shuttles run at :05, :25, and :45 past every hour from about 5 AM until about midnight, and if you need to get to the airport in the middle of the night, they get you there. Overall, a pleasant, well-run, cheerful, and friendly place, with clean rooms, good food, and very convenient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ladycasey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Seattle Airport &Conference Center for a large event. It was very enjoyable. The in-hotel dining was great. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the airport…..”
Reviews.Author: jbwilkins
Reviews.Content: I tend to stay here when I have a flight back home early the next morning….it beats fighting traffic from Bellevue (where I have business)…..Steakhouse downstairs is open for breakfast and there’s a shuttle to/from the airport that runs every 30-45 minutes…….Never had a bad experience, but I’m pretty easy to please…..

Reviews.Title: “Airport convenience biggest amenity”
Reviews.Author: DLCote
Reviews.Content: Generally a standard, clean hotel living up to the Hilton brand. Room was fine. Only stayed one night as a stopover between flying into Seattle and leaving the next day for a cruise. It was very convenient with regular complimentary shuttles to close-by Sea-Tac. Got the breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant. Was pretty expensive per person but the food quality and choices were good. Can optionally order a la carte.

Reviews.Title: “NAM host hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shemstrom
Reviews.Content: The room itself was good. Nothing different from any other hotel room. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was a bit tight, with the door opening into the toilet. There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room either. The National American Miss competition was held the weekend of September 2-4. We were given the rate that everyone that was staying got. We were put in the farthest room away from the convention center which made it a very long walk to and from for events that we had to get to. We ate dinner in the hotel resturant one night. The prices were crazy. I was extremely shocked when the bill came and my lemon drop was $13, (my meal was $26). No salad provided with dinner either. The place was not busy, but the service was very slow for some reason. I would recommend not eating in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Way to Rest Up for Next Day Flights East”
Reviews.Author: swabby1976
Reviews.Content: A great decision to get a good nights sleep before heading east from Seatac. Used the shuttle to return the rental car early so the next morning we could focus on getting on our east-bound flight to ATL and then IND. Great service and very nice beds .. zzzzzz.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly greetings and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: RicknLinda
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel If you fly into Seattle, great shuttle time close to Sea-Tac . If you drive self Parking clue, enter property from International BLVD ps parking kind of pricey for guests- packages come with breakfast buffet- upgrade $3 ...worth it packages and honors members free internet Dinner $ savings , and waistline too eat in bar, the bar menu few bucks cheaper and smaller portions (Petite Fillet and prawn good portion and great taste) Starbucks fans ....starbucks on premises

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a bit corporate for our taste”
Reviews.Author: RJones404
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with comfortable beds. Staff were very friendly and accommodating and it does offer a shuttle service from the airport (however you can walk here from the airport by using the skybridge to the light rail link in about 10 minutes). Nice outdoor pool area and walking distance from a few restaurant/diners including 13 Coins and Denny's. We stayed here after travelling from the UK (a 14 hour trip from Glasgow) because we planned to drive to Mount St Helen's the next day and wanted a hotel with an outdoor pool. However, the hotel itself seemed more set up for business conferences and had the typical US conference hotel look. Not my favourite place I have stayed and would think twice before staying here again although there was really nothing wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to walk and walk and walk! And pay for parking!”
Reviews.Author: Fatbearbc
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night here to break up the drive between Vancouver BC and Portland. $63 a night from Priceline (and, as many others have complained, another $20 for parking). It's a lovely hotel but built like a Vegas hotel (i.e. very spread out). The staff are less than enthusiastic (perhaps from many years of being blasted for charging for parking at an airport hotel!) but the room is very nice. Comfy beds, flat screen TV with lots of high-def channels. There is free wi-fi (lobby only, otherwise you're paying for it) and a nice pool (packed with screaming kids, alas). Lots of noise from the hall way, too. We were grateful to have to deal with only one night. For those without a car, it would seem like a better deal. There is a big transit station right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Chain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spunkymo
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a nice size, clean. Had a room with two beds facing the inner courtyard on 1st floor. It was quiet and we could not hear hear any noise from the airport. Light rail train was opposite the hotel and is convenient for those with no car. Parking costs $20/day which allows in & out privileges. Hotel had a restaurant and also an area you could purchase coffee, muffins, cereal for breakfast in the morning. There is also a Denny's about a block away. Air conditioner in the lobby is on super high and is very cold. Even in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 66HappyTrvlr
Reviews.Content: My flight was canceled and I had no choice but to stay over for the night. Going back into Seattle was not an option because I was re-booked for a flight departing at 5:40am. Given that it was already 10:30pm by the time my original flight was canceled all I wanted to do was go to sleep. The area at SEA_TAC where you wait for the hotel shuttles is full of fumes, ugly and overall unpleasant. This is no fault of the hotel but it does make for a good impression. Also, the wait for the shuttle seems like it took too long. Although the shuttle driver was quite pleasant. Check-in was a little slow as 10+ people exited the shuttle at the same time and all headed toward check-in. It would have been nice if there was a swing person at the front desk to accommodate the sudden influx of guests. The walk to the room was ridiculously long. The corridors seem to go on forever and ever. The carpets are hideous. Who designs those things?! The room was a amply sized with king size bed, nightstand, desk and chair, lounge chair, flat screen tv, and console. The bed was surprisingly comfortable with soft sheets, good pillows and a nice weight comforter. If it were not for the bed I would give a 3.5 rating to the hotel but the bed was so comfy that I boost the rating to a 4.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hilton hotel”
Reviews.Author: paramyself
Reviews.Content: I got the rooms from priceline. We were told since we got it from priceline we were assigned rooms with two double beds. We have to pay $10 to upgrade to a king room. I've won Hilton through priceline all over the country. This was the first time I hear this. I didn't argue with them. But it's surly disappointing. Parking isn't cheap. Rooms are on the small side. They don't have a printer for guests as the doubletree next door does. Other than these, it's a OK Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “memorable”
Reviews.Author: gigi71011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Seattle Hilton (Airport) in June, using it as a launch for the beginning of our 25th anniversary cruise. We were pleasantly surprised at the beauty of the gardens, and the spaciousness of the rooms. We expected little from a airport hotel, and were delighted with our stay there. One of the little touchs that I particularly liked, was a huge glass modern art decanter filled with water, ice and lemons adjacent to the registration desk. It looked so refreshing and welcomed us in the most beautiful way.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but Excessive Parking Charges”
Reviews.Author: BobLDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: The hotel, rooms, etc. are lovely, modern, and very well appointed. What I didn't expect was to find a $20 per day charge for overnight parking. If this were a downtown/city hotel you might expect it, but this is an airport/suburban hotel, and the $20 was a ripoff. I was not made aware of the charge until I entered the garage with my car and saw the posted signs - already checked in and way too late to make another choice. They say the charge is on their website, but I never used their website. In fairness, they cut the charge in half after I complained. Too bad about the excessive charges. I would have rated it higher and if you are only using their shuttle, then it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: bishoparc
Reviews.Content: Just your standard Hilton but the bed wasn't quite as comfortable as the other HIlton's I've stayed in. Very close proximity to the airport (just across the street.) Try to avoid staying in a room that faces the airport because the noise from outside is quite loud at night. I actually like a little bit of road noise to help me sleep but this was over and above a little bit. Parking was expensive, $26/day for valet. Overall it was an ok hotel but definitely nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeRabe
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice. First time we stayed at a Hilton. Very plush lobby and appearance in general. Ate at there restruant. Very expensive and not worth the money. Pool area nice, but under construction.

Reviews.Title: “yuk------what happening to the Hilton property”
Reviews.Author: Monilad
Reviews.Content: Spent one night on business. The room I was given was very large on first floor with two king size beds. Patio door into the pool area. Very nice Hilton beds. When I entered the non-smoking room it smelled like a cross between musty old clothes and cleaning supplies. I checked into the property about 10:00pm so I went to check the room service menu for dinner and zap, no menu in room book which looked like it had been used for a scratch pad. Had to call room service to find out choices. Although, the room did had left over things from the previous people, notes on pad, old check in folder, dirty coffee cup, candy bar in drawer. The bathroom was nice and clean but very skimpy on towels and no bathmat. Accident waiting to happen. I went to close the drapes and the pull wand was broken off and laying against wall. Not a lot of help there huh? I have stayed at this property a few other times with always the Hilton level of rooms. Not this time. Not sure if they are cutting back on staff or just careless room staff. My advise would be to find another hotel in area! Not worth the cost of room.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: TP2WXC
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers free shuttle service to and from airport. It has a very nice 24 hours gym and heated pool. The tram that goes to Seattle download is also next to the hotel. Service is good as expected from a Hilton. The room was large and clean and well kept. I recommend this airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Appearances are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: mrfalcon
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly for the most part. Be advised of the $50 per night pre auth to be put on your credit card. Everything has a price here. There is a much better free continental breakfast down the street at the Sleep Inn. The only way to get a free one here is to have enough HHonors points.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton as always”
Reviews.Author: lorrainelimiac
Reviews.Content: Cruise layover. Nice place, took the shuttle to downtown for 12 per person each way. Parking is crazy expensive if you dont stay there but I took advantage of the 10 bucks a day to park for 8 days. Hilton as always are nice and this was no exception. Probably not the perfect cruise layover but effient cost effective and predictable. The filipino woman in the front tried to ding me to get a king size bed (I am 6'2"). It took a little argueing and she finally said "ok but only this time", which when i walked away I thought thats a little silly...........what only bad service this time???

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Atl30309
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you want to stay near airport. We stayed here even though we did alot of things in Seattle because it is convenient to the light rail, only 20 minutes from downtown by car and great for heading west to the mountains or south to Tacoma. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Staff was helpful. the only downside was the charge for internet services.

Reviews.Title: “The best folks there were the evening valets”
Reviews.Author: Wolfiesaurus
Reviews.Content: An airport hotel should never tell a late night arriving guest that they may have to wait several hours before their room will be ready and that they can wait at the bar....after knowing the guest has a pre seven am flight.

Reviews.Title: “For the business traveler with a late check-in, be warned.”
Reviews.Author: Cbrant
Reviews.Content: I booked an overnight stay online for a layover. I informed the hotel that I would be checking in around 10:30 pm and would be leaving at 7:00 am the next day so I would appreciate a quick checkin. I arrived at 11:30 (delayed flight) and the representative at the desk told me there were no clean rooms, that he wasn't sure when there would be a clean room, and that I could just wait. I asked what he expected me to do and he informed me that I could wait a couple of hours in the lobby but he wasn't sure how long that wait would be. I informed the representative that although it wasn't his fault, I was a bit disturbed that I might not get a room until 2:30 in the morning and then check out at 6:30 am. He stared at me with a blank stare and shrugged. At this point I requested that they cancel my reservation (luckily a friend had checked in earlier and had a room in which I could crash) and he so kindly informed me that they would waive the late cancellation fee... Right. I felt horrible for the fellow late night travelers left stranded.... Not once did Hilton's representative act engaged or concerned. Moreover I would expect some sort of apology and perhaps an offer for coffee etc. While suggesting I wait 2-3 hours for a clean room at midnight. That being said, my friend's room seemed clean. The bed was comfortable and the proximity to SEA-TAC can't be beat-that is if you actually get a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Catching a Plane”
Reviews.Author: Cares4Quality
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Airport Hilton in Seattle in order to avoid being delayed by traffic for an early morning flight. The location could not have been better. There is a nearby walkway, so if you are ambitions and just taking carry-on luggage you could even walk. We decided to take the van because our plane was leaving before dawn. Here we had a basic hitch in that the bell captain assured us we had plenty of time to eat breakfast, and they would come get us when the van was ready to depart. Unfortunately, they didn’t -- fortunately, in spite of being left behind, the next van did take us to the airport in plenty of time. The breakfast was excellent, as were the lunch and dinners we had the day before and on New Year’s Eve at the on-site restaurant, Spencers. Overall the staff was gracious and eager to please, although they occasionally missed the mark. The halls and rooms were a bit stuffy, and they didn’t quite succeed at keeping all the plane noise down on the airport side of the building. The lobby and rooms are sumptuously well furnished. We had to arrive early because we were dropped off, and actually enjoyed hanging out by the fireplace until our room was ready. Regarding value, you do pay for the luxury and location.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel makes a bad name for Hilton :(”
Reviews.Author: CoronaBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for an event and I was less than impressed to say the least. The hotel is located by the airport and with little things to do near by with the exception of a few fast food places. The hotel staff are not very acccomidating. I had booked my room 2 months in advance and had requested a fridge but was declined one at check in. There were no working ice machines anywhere on the 2nd floor and due to the strange shape of this hotel it would take 10 minutes just to get sw ice. Internet will cost you $15/day and I find this unacceptable in 2011. When you're paying $120+ nigt the Internet should be free. There was no WiFi in the conference area either:( The hotel restaurant is overpriced and the food is just ok. I'd eat elsewhere. If you need assistance the front desk staff lack any type of hospitality skills. I asked on arrival and my day of departure for a late check out (1.5 hours). I was given an extra 15 minutes or "additional chargers would take place". In conclusion, I would rate this hotel at a 3 star at the best and give it a 2/10 for value. Will not say here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Can't be Beat”
Reviews.Author: Dr-Jill-from-NH
Reviews.Content: I love clean, well-appointed hotels that I can safely walk to from the airport. That's the case with this Hilton. If you follow the signs for the "Link Light Rail" you will end up in a station on the west side of International Drive. Simply continue on the pedestrian bridge onto the east side of International Drive, take the elevator to the street level, and you'll be facing the Hilton. What's even better is that, once you check in, you can take the Link Light Rail to downtown Seattle in a scant half-hour for $2.50 each way. This Hilton is a low-rise surrounding a pleasant courtyard; ask for a room facing onto this courtyard. It doesn't have a Hilton HHonors lounge, but it does have a restaurant serving a decent breakfast buffet. (I can't vouch for the quality of food at other times of the day since I've only eaten breakfast there.) The rooms are appointed with good-quality furnishings and the comfy Hilton bedding. Despite its proximity to the airport, the rooms are quiet and I had no trouble sleeping. The staff members are very friendly and helpful. Traffic in Seattle is so awful that, if you've got a morning flight out of SEATAC airport, I urge you to stay overnight at the Hilton Seattle Airport on your last night in town. You will be treated well and will have no trouble making your flight in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Jet n park package”
Reviews.Author: Marks21
Reviews.Content: How do these rooms not have mini fridges? Bar food was good. Did the fly n jet package. Buses run late during busy times. Overall I would say "meh". Two out of five. Oh yeah...place is kinda sleazy...watch out for ladies of the night coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “as a business traveler, this hotel made me feel comfortable”
Reviews.Author: EliteTraveler511
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the attention to detail that the staff provided to me during my business trip to Seattle. I usually stay at Hiltons and Marriots and preferred this property over any of the Marriots in Seattle. The workout center was located in a convenient place and the staff at the lounge bar were extremely pleasant. I will be booking again and again when I am on business travel to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice property with expensive, but convenient parking.”
Reviews.Author: mtgops
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves staying at the Hilton across from SeaTac due to a special that was being run by another hotel booking web site. We were visiting Seattle for a banquet in the Renton area and felt that this location would be satisfactory enough for an overnight stay even though we would be driving quite a bit between the hotel, the banquet and other activities we had planned to do while in town. The first thing I realized after booking this hotel was that parking was not included. In fact, you are pretty hard pressed to find too many 3 star or better properties near the airport that do not charge for parking in addition to the room price. There are a few 2 star and 2.5 star places that do offer guests parking as part of their stay and I’m actively seeking them out when I stay in the Seattle or SeaTac area. I suppose the parking is the only issue I have with this property, $20+tax/night for parking is a little high. I was pleased that we had unlimited in/out privileges with the parking and the room key card was utilized to let us in and out of the parking garage. The parking garage is at the rear of the property and also houses a large chunk of the Hilton’s conference center. A covered walkway connects the parking garage/conference center to the rest of the property. Our room was quite spacious even though it was a double queen room. The room did adjoin another guestroom, however we never heard or saw any of the guests that might have been staying in the rooms next to ours. Linens were bright and clean and the room was very well kept up, in keeping with typical Hilton standards. I was pleased to see that there was no bedspread, but only a small decorative cover at the foot of the bed. I’m always very glad when I visit a hotel that has dispensed with full bead spreads and covers beds in linens that are fully launderable after each guest. The room appeared to have been upgraded and updated at least in the last couple of years. Plumbing features and the bathroom had been fully updated with tile and granite. Coffee service in the room was good, but there were only disposable cups for the coffee. This isn’t a bad thing, but an observation as one of the photos for this hotel on Trip Advisor indicates that there are china mugs for the coffee station. The mugs must have gone away at some point in the past for some reason. For a one night stay, or longer for a conference or a weekend, the Hilton at SeaTac is a very nice property. If you are counting your pennies or wondering about costs aside from the room rate, beware that you will pay extra for parking and you will also pay extra for Internet access. I would stay here again because it was clean, comfortable and, for the price I paid, an acceptable value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, & Service”
Reviews.Author: goodnorthern
Reviews.Content: Walk to this very nice hotel from Sea-Tac, skip the rental car and hop on the light rail to downtown minutes from your front door. Staff was awesome---pool is seasonal, good hot tub though. Breakfast is fantastic. Bathroom had one issue but easily taken care of---other than that a clean room. This is a conference center so there are great amenities. I booked on Priceline and got a great rate but will be making this my Sea-Tac hotel of choice in the future. If you can't or don't want to eat at the hotel 13Coins (open 24 hours) is right down the street. STAY HERE! Bummer, no fridge in the room or free internet, oh well. Very comfy bed---could hear hallway noise somewhat.

Reviews.Title: “You Will Walk Miles and Miles”
Reviews.Author: SeabournFan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are MILES and MILES from check in. The one hotel restaurant is over top expensive for a humble airport hotel. Rooms are Hilton Standard. Clean, but you feel slightly gheto in the hotels location A dull airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great service”
Reviews.Author: MVTeacher
Reviews.Content: The hotel is directly across the street from the airport. Once you manage to navigate to the shuttle pick-up location (all hotels pick up at the same site) , shuttles run every 20 minutes. I have stayed here twice in the last year. The greeting at the front desk is warm and inviting. Help was offered for luggage but nothing pushy (I declined help since the bag is on wheels). Room was ready, clean, and extremely comfortable. Had a late lunch and sat at the bar. Steak sandwich was delicious and reasonably priced. Good selection of draft beers. Pleasant conversation with the bartender. Upon check-out, clerk seemed genuinely interested in knowing if my stay was satisfactory. Overall, nice location and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic for a high dollar hotel”
Reviews.Author: alaskaviking
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 8:30 pm till 6:am because it was next to the airport & we had a layover. We ordered the over priced room service food & it was terrible. Then to top things off the toilet was pre-clogged & overflowed when flushed. After about an hour after calling the front desk & speaking to a rude woman, an asian janitor arrived to help. He was nice enough but did not speak english, & as it turned out he didn't know what he was doing because the toilet didn't flush in the morning either. What a great layover thanks to Hilton for a room we paid $190 for. At least they did have comfortable beds & nice sheets. When we checked out & complained when asked how our stay was, we were offered a $50 discount on our next stay. Did not accept & never stayed at a Hiton since.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to the airport. But nothings for free.”
Reviews.Author: craig_traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night This is a large business/conference hotel across from the airport. Parking was expensive, especially when theres options on the same street with free parking (Coast Inn, Radisson, Comfort Inn). If you can walk, theres free parking in the residential neighborhood behind the hotel. But its quite a hike, uphill to get there. Hotel is typical for a large chain. Front desk staff were in very limited supply when I arrived at about 10:00pm. Only one person working the desk for a line of people about 10 deep. Another clerk finally arrives and the line started to move. Rooms are typical Hilton, nothing all too remarkable about them. Hotel is oddly layed out, so may be hard to get your bearings. Recommended if you can get a very good rate, like on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel minus all the nickle and dime extras”
Reviews.Author: Expat_American
Reviews.Content: Used Priceline and got this hotel for 2 nights at $65/night. Got killed with the $20/night parking fee that Priceline fails to mention. Now for the surprises. Checked in around 7pm on a Sunday post Thanksgiving and got a "free upgrade" upon check in which surprised me! First offer was for a single king bed with court yard view. Asked if that was easy to get to for unloading 4 suitcases and 4 carry on's. The desk agent thought about it for a minute and then offered me a better room (double king bed!) a short distance from the parking garage and easy access to the side doors. It had an obstructed view of the courtyard, but this time of year who cares. We had more than enough space to spread out and repack our luggage one last time. The TV in the room is a large 37 inch HD flat screen with 95% of the channels shown in HD. There were 5 or so analog channels (Fox News and some others) and 5 or so audio only channels. So now to pro and cons of staying here. Pros: Free 2 computer and printer business center (room key required) Computers are not secure like the Fedex Office computers. Public and house phones across the hall from the computer room. Friendly staff. Convenient location to airport with large parking garage at hotel. Wifi free if you goto the lobby and sit in the big couches. Small retail store for travelers aids. Starbucks hot coffee served at lobby restaurant, which is a steak and chops and wine restaurant. Rooms highly insulated against aircraft noise (still comes through a bit) State of the art temperature control for room on wall. Window heater/arico unit is quieter than most. Beds are comfortable but pillows are really soft. Free USA Today delivered to door early in the morning. Checkout easy if everything is prepaid, can be done via a button on the phone. Ipod ready radio on night stand with multi button generalized music style selection. TV has a flight departure channel. Rooms are modern and new looking (found some paint on the sprinkler head). Bath/Shower has railing for lesser mobile persons to hold on to while getting in and out of the shower. Two levels of soap/shampoo holders Cons: $20/night + tax parking fee (covered and monitored parking garage) and $26/night + tax for Valet. (mostly outside parking) $4.95(?) for 30 mins of wired in room internet or $12.95(?) for 24hrs. $4 a bottle "artisan" water in room. Water pressure in shower head really low (flow restrictor) compared to faucet output to tub. Housekeeping left the carts near our room (end of hallway) on Sunday and cleared them out at end of the shift on Monday. Housekeeping did not clean up sticky mess on TV remote and TV counter top before we checked in. Also did not refresh the room on Monday morning, called them Monday night and they sent someone over to give fresh wash clothes and empty the trash cans. Told them to forget the beds as it was 7pm at night. They offered 2 bottles of "cheap" water on the house for the inconvenience. Blackout curtains work ok, but do not really "blackout" the early morning light. Did see one "working girl" leaving the hotel in the hallway since the hotel has many entrances to the rooms hallways and this part of Seattle is known for this trade to be around. Note: They offer a recycle bag, but when the housekeeper came at night (see above) she tossed the bag and all the rest of the trash into a black trash bag.. Maybe it is sorted out later. Overall impression: Great hotel if not for the nickle and dime routine and high parking cost.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: rodjune
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here. The shuttle was fast and efficient from the airport. Check-in was fast due to the late hour that I arrived. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. There was an in-room coffee and tea set up which I used. The shuttle back to the airport was easy to use and right on time. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but I feel used”
Reviews.Author: zackinspok
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel. Great location, nice room, wonderful restaurant. Why does the Hilton ruin it all by niggling on every service offered? Twenty dollars a day for self-parking, four dollars for a bottled water, expensive hook up fees for internet. It goes on and on but the end result is that they made me feel used by the end of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bargain Around”
Reviews.Author: fullprof
Reviews.Content: Obtained through Priceline (check prices on Bidingfortravel.com). Great room with a comfortable mattress, excellent bathroom, hugh tv, and down pillows. Dennys is right across the street for an inexpensive meal. Avoided the $20 parking fee by returning my rental and using the hotels' free shuttle service. Noticed a large number of flight staff from the airlines stayed here. Very large hotel, so your room can be a good distance from the lobby. Several computers allowing internet access next to the cafe.

Reviews.Title: “still a great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: Since my last review in 2006 the hotel has had some updating. Our room had new carpet and bedspread as did the hallway. Also I am now Hhonors Gold so we got the Hhonors floor. Excellent hotel breakfast - we got Gold coupons but had to pay $5 extra to get the hot breakfast. Still it was very good. Our room was very nice. Comfy beds one of the better Hilton beds I have used. I asked to have the feathers removed when we checked in - and the housekeeping staff beat us to the room they were already there doing it by the time we got there on the elevator. Valet parking was $26 a night somewhat pricy for a leisure stay. The entire staff was great during our stay I can highly recommend this hotel. Very convenient to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced without free Internet”
Reviews.Author: ardeophyte
Reviews.Content: In 2010, I can't understand why most large hotel chains cannot offer free Internet to their guests -- even in Seattle which is one of the most "connected" cities in the country. I would wager that most people under age 40 would much rather have free Internet, even if it was "wired" with an Ethernet cable, than free HBO. I even spent some time trying to get on nearby Holiday Inn's free wireless (couldn't). Otherwise it was $13 for 24 hours. My particular conference was in this hotel so I booked the Hilton for the convenience factor. In my opinion, that's probably the highlight of the Hilton SeaTac -- it's near the airport. Yes, the rooms are clean, the service is complete, and I had no overall complaints with my stay or comfort. Yet, even with the group rate member discount, the rate of $200 per night is nowhere near worth it. The restaurant food is high quality, but around $30 or more per plate. Breakfasts are $20. If you can bear a walk through shady SeaTac up the road, you can find a Denny's for cheaper food. All in all, it's a nice place, but hardly worth the price of convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: nonny1947
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel but I don't think it has family atmosphere. It is made for business. Didn't like the fact that I had to pay to park.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel for the price. Excellent beds. Excellent Rooms & Lobby”
Reviews.Author: kalilama
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay for an overnight . I would have stayed longer if my flight wasn't the next day. The beds are the best...very comfortable. The bathroom is nice and large and the rooms are a great size. If you don't want to pay for wireless in your room just go to the very comfortable lobby and boot up your computer from there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pre flight stay”
Reviews.Author: kidzRNSeattle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before a 5:50 am flight. Got a great rate on Priceline. Lobby is lovely and check in fast and friendly. I asked them to put us in a room that was close due to a foot injury, but we were in a room 2 long hallways away. Room smelled fresh and was very clean.The view was on the back of some bushes. I do think they put customers that book through on line sites in less desirable rooms, but other than the location, it was fine. Beds a little soft, but nice pillows. NO BEDBUGS!! Nice large flat screen TV and small sitting area Of course they chaqnge for internet. Ordered room service and everything we got was great. Hash browns are a meal in themselves!! They have a nice pool that we used on previous stays. Check out was fast and airport shuttle was easy and I appreciated the friendly driver at 4:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “average room, but expect to be nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: nickTF
Reviews.Content: The room is your average hotel room, nothing noteworthy, but nothing really terrible. There was a little mold in the corners of the shower, but not excessive. Although for a 3.5 star hotel I would expect better. The bed was comfortable and noise was not a problem, the disappointing part is how they nickle and dime you. Paying for parking is to be expected, but when asked are there any cheaper lots around they failed to mention the one just across the street. My booking was supposed to be a guaranteed king room, but they told me if I wanted to upgrade my two double beds to a single king I would have to pay $10 extra. It's like that for everything. Anything you want you pay. Internet access you pay. This is the first hotel where I've stayed at as a guest that I've had to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: shoeluv
